intro: Plinia sintenisii, commonly known as the Brazilian pineapple or pitanga, is a species of plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, fleshy, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, acidic flavor. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 4 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive reddish-brown color when mature. The flowers are white and clustered, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit.
